noun.description: An instance of declining to vote for or against a proposal or motion.
examples: a resolution passed by 126 votes to none, with six abstentions

noun.description: The fact or practice of restraining oneself from indulging in something; abstinence.

origin: Early 16th century (denoting the action of keeping back or restraining): from late Latin abstentio(n-), from the verb abstinere (see abstain).
